      "cash_evidence_citation": "Savings balances almost triple, significantly increasing from USD 4.8 to 13.0. This 8.2 USD increase in savings represents approximately 7% of the total stipend of 120 USD (i.e. 10 USD a month for 12 months) disbursed over the course of the program."

    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "We measure the program impacts one and two years after the program start on four families of outcomes: household consumption and assets, and women's employment and finances, empowerment, and health. | Table 3 shows the estimated average effects on consumption and assets. | Table 4 shows impacts on employment and financial outcomes. | Table 5 estimates the treatment effects on women's empowerment. | Table 6 shows the estimated treatment effects on mental and physical health.",

    "has_cost_data": true,
    "cost_mentions": "The WfWI intervention breaks even after 4-5 years and has a BCR of 368 percent and an IRR of 19.9 percent.",
    "cost_evidence_citation": "Using only non-durable consumption, we estimate that the WfWI intervention breaks even after 4-5 years and has a BCR of 368 percent and an IRR of 19.9 percent."
